Following itmes shall be marked on the battery or package:

  • Polarity of terminal (when applicable)
  • Name or trade mark of the manufacturer or supplier
  • Battery electrochemical system
  • Nominal voltage
  • Rated Capacity in mAh
  • Year, month, week, or day of manufacture, which may be coded, or the expiration date h) Warnings or cautionary notes, where applicable
  • Caution for ingestion (small batteries only)
  • Recycle mark (where regulations apply)
  • Country of origin

Cells (batteries) for portable applications

On the secondary battery or its package a designation shall be placed which gives information about the nominal voltage, the electrochemical system and the physical dimensions, thermal configurations, performance variables.

Example: the ANSI standards define the following designation:

  • First number to indicate the nominal voltage: amount of cells multiplies by the nominal cell voltage
  • A letter to indicate the electrochemical system. For Lithium ion the l is used
  • Number with the information about physical dimensions, thermal configurations, performance variables. These numbers are defined in the standard
